biospec_descr.textblock:
5-10mL of adipose cells in tumescent solution

      5-10mL of venous blood

brief_summary.textblock:
This study aims at finding endophenotypes of schizophrenia at neuronal level by obtaining
      stem cells which is derived from adipose cells of subjects with heavy genetic loading for
      schizophrenia then differentiating them into neuronal cells.

clinical_study.brief_title: Stem Cell Research on Subjects at Genetic High Risk for Schizophrenia

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

        [Subjects at genetic high risk for schizophrenia]

          -  Healthy without any Axis I mental disorder

          -  Is a monozygotic twin of a patient with schizophrenia OR Has at least two family
             members of schizophrenia in the pedigree, including at least one 1st-degree family
             member

        [Healthy Control]

          -  Healthy without any Axis I mental disorder

          -  No family members of schizophrenia in the pedigree to the 3rd degree

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Significant neurological or medical illness

          -  Psychotic symptoms

          -  Substance abuse

          -  Suicidal risk

          -  Blindness or hearing loss

          -  Taking aspirin, warfarin or hormonal agents

          -  Pregnancy or lactation

          -  Susceptibility for keloid formation

          -  Allergy to lidocaine

          -  History of significant head trauma or loss of consciousness

          -  Mental retardation

study_pop.textblock:
-  Subjects at genetic high risk for schizophrenia

          -  Healthy control

clinical_study.official_title: Stem Cell-based Approaches to Neuronal Characteristics and Endophenotype of Schizophrenia in Genetic High Risk Subjects

primary_outcome.description:
in vitro measurement of the expression of the neuronal markers for differentiated post-mitotic neuron, GABAergic/Glutamatergic neuron.
The  neuronal connectivity, neurites from soma and synaptic protein levels will be assessed. In addition, RNA and proteins expression (e.g. Glutamate/GABA receptors) , physiological function, and in vitro response to antipsychotics will be evaluated.
primary_outcome.measure: Structural and functional characteristics of neurons differentiated from adipose tissue derived stem cells in subjects with genetic high risk for schizophrenia and healthy controls

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Clinical rating scale for prodromal symptoms of psychosis.
secondary_outcome.measure: CAARMS(Comprehensive assessment of at risk mental states)

secondary_outcome.description: Clinical rating scale for the assessment of symptoms of schizophrenia.
Neurocognitive function battery comprising tests measuring subjects' intelligence, attention, memory, executive function and social cognitive function.
ERP profile including P50, P30 & MMN(Mismatch Negativity).
Molecular neuroimaging data measuring neurochemical composition profile.
PET imaging data measuring receptor availability of GABA(gamma-aminobutyric acid) and Glutamate.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case Control, Time Perspective: Cross-Sectional
